images.caption: Figure 1:Density field evolution with velocity quiver plots for the Basic Shear Layer test case (Re=1000, Ri=0.25) at four time instances:t=0.00t=0.00s showing initial stratification,t=2.42t=2.42s displaying early billow formation,t=4.95t=4.95s demonstrating developed vortex structures, andt=7.47t=7.47s presenting late-stage mixing patterns. Color contours indicate density values from 1.008 to 1.200 kg/m3, with white arrows representing velocity vectors scaled to 1 m/s reference magnitude.

Figure 2:Density field evolution with velocity quiver plots for the Double Shear Layer test case (Re=2000, Ri=0.1) showing:t=0.00t=0.00s with distinct three-layer initial stratification (ρ=1.5\rho=1.5, 1.0, 1.5 kg/m3),t=3.72t=3.72s displaying dual billow development at separated interfaces,t=7.45t=7.45s demonstrating vortex interaction and pairing, andt=11.17t=11.17s presenting merged turbulent structures. Enhanced mixing occurs through interaction between the two shear interfaces separated by 0.3 m.

Figure 3:Density field evolution with velocity quiver plots for the Rotating KH Instability test case (Re=1500, Ri=0.3,f=0.5f=0.5s-1) at:t=0.00t=0.00s showing initial 30% density stratification,t=4.93t=4.93s displaying rotationally-modified billow development,t=9.95t=9.95s demonstrating sustained coherent structures, andt=14.98t=14.98s presenting quasi-steady rotating vortices. Rotation inhibits vertical mixing while maintaining organized flow patterns throughout the 20-second simulation.

Figure 4:Density field evolution with velocity quiver plots for the Forced KH Turbulence test case (Re=5000, Ri=0.15) on384×192384\times 192grid showing:t=0.00t=0.00s initial weak stratification,t=7.43t=7.43s displaying forced turbulent structures,t=14.95t=14.95s demonstrating sustained mixing patterns, andt=22.48t=22.48s presenting statistical equilibrium state. Continuous spectral forcing maintains turbulent fluctuations preventing relaminarization throughout the extended 30-second simulation period.
